isis.stitle: CALIPER DISC BRAKES - SERVICE PROCEDURES - DISASSEMBLE CALIPER (BOTH SINGLE AND DUAL PISTON) TYPE

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLE CALIPER (BOTH SINGLE AND DUAL PISTON) TYPE

step1.para:
Remove caliper. Refer to , CALIPER AND PADS REMOVAL
.
Using a suitable screwdriver, pry off the heat shields from the caliper pistons.
Remove piston(s) from caliper using pliers designed for disc brake caliper piston removal. If pliers are not available or pliers cannot remove piston(s), remove pistons using compressed air.

warning.para: Do not insert any part of your hand between the caliper and block of wood or between the piston and caliper housing when injecting compressed air into the caliper to remove caliper pistons. Personal injury may occur.

step1.para: For dual and single piston caliper, place a block of wood between the caliper housing and the caliper piston(s). Leave approximately 1.0 to 1 1/2 inch clearance between the caliper piston(s) and the block of wood. Using compressed air and an air blow (gun), insert gun into inlet port of caliper. Inject air into caliper housing forcing piston(s) out of caliper. Remove block of wood and finish removing piston(s) from caliper using caliper piston pliers. If no pliers are available, place a suitable cover (such as a piece of cardboard or a thin book) over caliper piston opening). Hold cover firmly onto caliper and apply compressed air into the caliper again. The piston(s) will pop out of the caliper and the cover will contain the piston(s) from flying out and causing possible personal injury ( Figure 24).
Remove piston dust boot(s) and seal(s) from caliper housing.
